properties.areaDesc: Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:37PM MST until January 17 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO BRING HEAVY SNOW TO THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND
FREEZING RAIN TO PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN PLAINS...

.A complex winter storm system will bring several inches of snow
to northern New Mexico. The highest snow accumulations will be found
above 7500 feet with accumulations ranging from 6 to 10 inches
and over a foot possible in mountain peaks. Very strong westerly
winds on Friday may also create areas of blowing snow across
northern New Mexico. This winter storm system will also be
responsible for areas of freezing rain across portions of the
east-central plains Thursday morning and Thursday night. Total ice
accumulations will range from 0.05 to 0.10 inches will locally
higher amounts possible.

* WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow
accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, except up to 15 inches above
7500 feet and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch.
Winds gusting as high as 65 mph on Friday.

* WHERE...Northern Mountains, and Glorieta Mesa Including
Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...From 5 AM Thursday to 5 PM MST Friday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds on Friday
could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 5 PM MST FRIDAY
